text: Sample filter to generate Cryptomatte files for easy creation of keyable ID mattes.  See https://github.com/Psyop/Cryptomatte for tools and details.
Name of the EXR file to write the Cryptomatte to.
Where to store the object manifest.  Select 'None' if you do not wish to store a manifest at all.
What property to use to group objects and identify them in the manifest.  This will also be used to name the layer in the Cryptomatte file.

Name of the string attribute used to group objects and identify them in the manifest.  This will also be used to name the layer in the Cryptomatte file.  Only has an effect when 'Layer' is set to 'Attribute'.
The number of id/coverage pairs to store in the Cryptomatte file.

The number of extra id/coverage pairs computed but not stored.  Up to a point, increasing this produces a better estimate for pixels where there are many objects, but it does so at the expense of memory.
